issues.title: Timing Belt Failure (M20/M42 Engines)
issues.symptoms: Engine won't start, loud slapping noise before failure, visible belt wear or cracking
issues.description: The M20 (6-cylinder) and M42 (4-cylinder) engines in the E30 use timing belts rather than chains. These belts have a service interval of approximately 50,000 miles, but many recommend replacing them earlier. The M20 is an interference engine, meaning if the belt snaps, the pistons will contact the valves causing catastrophic engine damage.
issues.keywords: timing belt m20 m42 interference engine valves pistons service interval

issues.title: Rust and Corrosion
issues.symptoms: Bubbling paint, visible rust holes, soft floor pans, rusty fenders and wheel arches
issues.description: E30s are notorious for rust, especially in areas with road salt. Common rust spots include the front fenders, rear wheel arches, rocker panels, battery tray, and floor pans. The trunk floor and spare tire well are also vulnerable.
issues.keywords: rust corrosion fenders wheel arches rocker panels floor pans battery tray

issues.title: Electrical Gremlins
issues.symptoms: Intermittent gauge failures, flickering lights, dead pixels in OBC, non-working windows/sunroof
issues.description: The E30's electrical system suffers from age-related issues. Ground points corrode, causing erratic behavior. The instrument cluster capacitors fail, leading to dead gauges or pixels. Window and sunroof switches wear out.
issues.keywords: electrical ground instrument cluster capacitors gauges OBC windows sunroof switches

issues.title: Suspension Bushing Wear
issues.symptoms: Clunking over bumps, vague steering, uneven tire wear, wandering at highway speeds
issues.description: After 30+ years, nearly all E30s have worn suspension bushings. The front control arm bushings, subframe mounts, rear trailing arm bushings, and sway bar end links all deteriorate with age.
issues.keywords: suspension bushings control arm subframe trailing arm sway bar handling

issues.title: Fuel Injection Issues (Bosch Motronic)
issues.symptoms: Hard starting, rough idle, poor fuel economy, hesitation under acceleration, stalling
issues.description: E30s use Bosch Motronic or L-Jetronic fuel injection systems. Common failure points include the idle control valve (ICV), mass airflow sensor (AFM), coolant temperature sensor, and fuel injectors.
issues.keywords: fuel injection motronic l-jetronic ICV idle control valve AFM airflow sensor injectors

issues.title: Cooling System Failures
issues.symptoms: Overheating, coolant leaks, heater not working, temperature gauge fluctuation
issues.description: The E30's cooling system components fail with age. The water pump, thermostat, and radiator are common failure points. The heater core can leak, and the expansion tank can crack.
issues.keywords: cooling overheating water pump thermostat radiator heater core coolant

issues.title: Cooling System Failures
issues.symptoms: Overheating, coolant leaks, temperature gauge pegged high, steam from engine bay, heater blowing cold
issues.description: The E36 cooling system is notoriously fragile. BMW used plastic components that become brittle with heat cycles. The expansion tank, thermostat housing, water pump impeller, and radiator end tanks are all prone to failure.
issues.keywords: cooling overheating expansion tank thermostat water pump radiator plastic

issues.title: VANOS System Issues (M50TU/M52)
issues.symptoms: Rough idle, loss of low-end torque, engine rattle at startup, hesitation between 2500-3500 RPM
issues.description: The E36 with M50TU and M52 engines uses BMW's Single VANOS variable valve timing system. The VANOS unit's seals harden and fail over time, leading to oil leaks and loss of proper valve timing.
issues.keywords: vanos m50tu m52 variable valve timing seals rattle torque

issues.title: Rear Trailing Arm Bushing (RTAB) Failure
issues.symptoms: Clunking from rear over bumps, vague rear-end feel, rear tire wear on inside edge, visible bushing deterioration
issues.description: The rear trailing arm bushings on the E36 are a well-known weak point. When they wear out, they allow excessive movement of the rear wheels, affecting handling and causing accelerated tire wear.
issues.keywords: rtab rear trailing arm bushing suspension handling tire wear

issues.title: Window Regulator Failure
issues.symptoms: Window drops into door, grinding noise during operation, window moves slowly or crooked, clicking sounds
issues.description: E36 window regulators use plastic clips and guides that fail over time. When the clips break, the window can drop into the door panel. The regulators use a cable system that can also stretch or break.
issues.keywords: window regulator plastic clips cable door panel

issues.title: Oil Leaks
issues.symptoms: Oil spots under car, burning oil smell, visible oil on engine, low oil level between changes
issues.description: E36s are known for developing oil leaks. The valve cover gasket, oil filter housing gasket (OFHG), oil pan gasket, and rear main seal are all common leak points.
issues.keywords: oil leak valve cover gasket ofhg oil filter housing oil pan rear main seal

issues.title: Control Arm Bushings
issues.symptoms: Steering wheel vibration, clunking over bumps, pulling to one side, uneven front tire wear
issues.description: The E36 front suspension uses control arms with pressed-in bushings that wear over time. Worn bushings cause imprecise steering, vibration, and accelerated tire wear.
issues.keywords: control arm bushings suspension steering vibration tire wear

issues.title: Ignition System Failures
issues.symptoms: Misfires, rough idle, poor fuel economy, check engine light, hesitation under load
issues.description: The E36's ignition system components wear out. The ignition coils, spark plugs, plug wires, and crankshaft position sensor are common failure points.
issues.keywords: ignition coils spark plugs misfire crankshaft position sensor cps

issues.title: VANOS System Failure
issues.symptoms: Rough idle, loss of power, rattling noise on startup, check engine light, poor fuel economy
issues.description: The E46 uses Double VANOS for both intake and exhaust cam timing. The seals in the VANOS units harden over time, causing rattling and performance issues. The solenoids can also fail.
issues.keywords: vanos double vanos variable valve timing seals solenoid rattle

issues.title: Cooling System Failures
issues.symptoms: Overheating, coolant leaks, temperature gauge fluctuation, heater issues, steam from engine
issues.description: Like the E36, the E46 cooling system uses plastic components that fail. The expansion tank, thermostat housing, water pump, and radiator are common failure points.
issues.keywords: cooling overheating expansion tank thermostat water pump radiator plastic

issues.title: Rear Subframe Cracking
issues.symptoms: Clunking from rear, visible cracks in floor pan around subframe mounts, rear suspension feels loose
issues.description: The E46 has a known issue with the rear subframe mounts tearing out of the floor pan. This is a serious structural problem that can affect handling and safety. Common on higher-mileage cars and those driven hard.
issues.keywords: subframe cracking floor pan rear suspension structural mounts

issues.title: Window Regulator Failure
issues.symptoms: Window drops into door, grinding noise, slow window operation, window off track
issues.description: E46 window regulators use cable-driven mechanisms with plastic components that fail. Similar to E36, this is a common issue requiring regulator replacement.
issues.keywords: window regulator cable plastic door panel

issues.title: Control Arm Bushing Wear
issues.symptoms: Clunking over bumps, steering wheel shimmy, uneven tire wear, pulling to one side
issues.description: The E46 front control arm bushings wear out over time, affecting steering precision and causing noise. The thrust arm bushings are particularly prone to failure.
issues.keywords: control arm bushings thrust arm suspension steering clunking

issues.title: Timing Belt Failure
issues.symptoms: Engine won't start, loud slapping noise, bent valves after failure, visible belt cracking or fraying
issues.description: The 924's Audi-derived 2.0L inline-4 uses a timing belt. This is an interference engine, meaning if the belt breaks, the pistons will contact the valves, causing severe engine damage.
issues.keywords: timing belt interference engine valves pistons audi 2.0

issues.title: CIS Fuel Injection Problems
issues.symptoms: Hard starting, rough idle, hesitation under acceleration, poor fuel economy, flooding, black smoke
issues.description: The 924 uses Bosch K-Jetronic Continuous Injection System (CIS), a mechanical fuel injection system. Age causes the fuel distributor diaphragm to harden, injectors to clog, and control pressure regulator to fail.
issues.keywords: cis k-jetronic fuel injection bosch warm-up regulator injectors fuel distributor

issues.title: Clutch Cable and Clutch System Wear
issues.symptoms: Heavy clutch pedal, clutch slipping, difficulty shifting, clutch pedal sticks down, grinding when shifting
issues.description: The 924 uses a cable-operated clutch system. The clutch cable stretches with age and use, and the guide tube in the tunnel can wear. The throwout bearing and clutch fork pivot ball are high-wear items.
issues.keywords: clutch cable throwout bearing clutch fork transaxle shifting

issues.title: Rust and Corrosion
issues.symptoms: Bubbling paint, visible rust holes, soft floors, leaking trunk or cabin, rusty battery box
issues.description: The 924 is prone to rust in several well-known areas. The front fenders rust behind the headlights. The battery box corrodes from acid exposure. Door bottoms and rocker panels trap moisture.
issues.keywords: rust corrosion battery box fenders floor pans rocker panels

issues.title: Electrical System Issues
issues.symptoms: Intermittent no-start, dead gauges, flickering lights, non-functional windows/mirrors, fuel pump runs constantly
issues.description: The 924's electrical system suffers from age. The DME/fuel pump relay, corroded ground connections, and degraded wiring insulation are main culprits.
issues.keywords: electrical dme relay fuel pump ground connections wiring gauges

issues.title: Cooling System Failures
issues.symptoms: Overheating, coolant leaks, heater not working, temperature gauge fluctuation, steam from engine bay
issues.description: The 924's cooling system works hard. The water pump, thermostat, radiator's plastic end tanks, and heater core can all fail with age.
issues.keywords: cooling overheating water pump thermostat radiator heater core

issues.title: Transaxle and Differential Issues
issues.symptoms: Grinding when shifting, popping out of gear, whining noise from rear, difficulty engaging reverse, oil leaks at rear
issues.description: The 924 uses a rear-mounted transaxle. Common issues include worn synchros (especially 2nd gear), tired shift linkage, and differential wear.
issues.keywords: transaxle differential synchros shifting transmission gear oil

issues.title: Suspension and Steering Wear
issues.symptoms: Clunking over bumps, vague steering, uneven tire wear, wandering at highway speed, squeaking from front end
issues.description: After 35-45 years, nearly every 924 needs suspension attention. Common wear items include strut mounts, control arm bushings, tie rod ends, ball joints, and steering rack.
issues.keywords: suspension steering strut mounts control arm bushings tie rods ball joints

issues.title: Timing Belt and Balance Shaft Belt Failure
issues.symptoms: Engine won't start, catastrophic engine noise, bent valves, snapped belt visible through timing cover
issues.description: The 944's inline-4 is an interference engine that relies on timing and balance shaft belts. If either belt fails, the valves will contact the pistons, requiring an engine rebuild. This is the most critical maintenance item on the 944.
issues.keywords: timing belt balance shaft belt interference engine valves pistons critical maintenance

issues.title: Water Pump Failure
issues.symptoms: Coolant leak at front of engine, overheating, squealing noise from engine, play in water pump shaft
issues.description: The 944 water pump is driven by the timing belt. When the pump bearings or seals fail, coolant can leak into the timing belt area, contaminating and weakening the belt.
issues.keywords: water pump coolant leak timing belt overheating bearings seals

issues.title: DME Relay Failure
issues.symptoms: No-start condition, fuel pump doesn't prime, car dies while driving and won't restart, intermittent starting issues
issues.description: The DME relay is an infamous weak point on all 944s. This relay controls power to the fuel pump, fuel injectors, and engine management computer. Solder joints crack over time from thermal cycling.
issues.keywords: dme relay no start fuel pump injectors engine management solder

issues.title: Clutch Hydraulic System Failure
issues.symptoms: Clutch pedal goes to floor, soft or spongy pedal, difficulty shifting, clutch won't disengage, fluid leak
issues.description: The 944 uses a hydraulic clutch system with master and slave cylinders. Both cylinders use rubber seals that deteriorate over time, causing internal and external leaks.
issues.keywords: clutch hydraulic master cylinder slave cylinder pedal shifting bleeding

issues.title: Torque Tube Bearing Wear
issues.symptoms: Vibration at certain speeds, humming or growling noise from center of car, vibration when accelerating or decelerating
issues.description: The 944 uses a torque tube to connect the front engine to the rear transaxle. The center support bearing wears over time, causing vibrations and noise.
issues.keywords: torque tube bearing vibration driveshaft cv joint flex disc guibo

issues.title: Dashboard Cracking
issues.symptoms: Cracks appearing on dashboard surface, especially on top near windshield, warping, deteriorating texture
issues.description: The 944 dashboard is made of foam covered with vinyl and is extremely prone to cracking, especially in hot climates or when exposed to direct sunlight.
issues.keywords: dashboard cracking vinyl interior sun damage cosmetic

issues.title: Power Steering Rack Leaks
issues.symptoms: Power steering fluid leak, low fluid in reservoir, heavy steering when cold, whining from power steering pump
issues.description: The 944 power steering rack commonly develops leaks from seals as they age. Leaks typically occur at the pinion seal, tie rod end seals, or pressure line connections.
issues.keywords: power steering rack leak fluid pump seals tie rod

issues.title: Odometer and Speedometer Gear Failure
issues.symptoms: Odometer stops working while speedometer works, intermittent odometer, trip meter stuck
issues.description: The 944 instrument cluster uses plastic gears to drive the odometer from the speedometer. These gears strip or crack with age, causing the odometer to stop functioning.
issues.keywords: odometer speedometer gears instrument cluster vdo trip meter

issues.title: Engine Mount Deterioration
issues.symptoms: Excessive engine vibration, engine moves visibly during acceleration/deceleration, clunking when shifting, harsh NVH
issues.description: The 944 engine mounts deteriorate over time. The large inline-4 engine with balance shafts puts significant stress on these mounts, causing vibrations when worn.
issues.keywords: engine mounts vibration nvh clunking rubber polyurethane transaxle mounts

issues.title: Timing Belt Failure
issues.symptoms: Engine won't start, catastrophic engine noise, bent valves, visible belt damage
issues.description: The 928's V8 engine is an interference engine that uses a timing belt to drive the camshafts. Belt failure results in piston-to-valve contact and catastrophic engine damage.
issues.keywords: timing belt v8 interference engine valves pistons camshaft rollers

issues.title: Cam Tower Gasket and Oil Leaks
issues.symptoms: Oil leaks at top of engine, burning oil smell, oil on exhaust manifolds, low oil level, smoke from engine bay
issues.description: The 928 V8 is notorious for oil leaks, primarily from the cam tower gaskets. These gaskets harden with age and heat, causing oil to leak onto exhaust manifolds.
issues.keywords: oil leak cam tower gasket valve cover cylinder head rear main seal

issues.title: Engine Wiring Harness Deterioration
issues.symptoms: Random misfires, check engine light, running issues, no-start conditions, sensors not reading correctly
issues.description: The 928's engine wiring harness is routed through a hot area and uses insulation that becomes brittle and cracks with age. This causes short circuits and intermittent connections.
issues.keywords: wiring harness electrical insulation short circuit sensors misfires

issues.title: Automatic Transmission Issues
issues.symptoms: Harsh shifting, slipping, delayed engagement, no movement in gear, fluid leaks, overheating warning
issues.description: Most 928s have automatic transmissions that require proper maintenance. Common issues include worn valve body, torque converter failure, and failed seals.
issues.keywords: automatic transmission shifting slipping torque converter valve body atf fluid

issues.title: Cooling System Failures
issues.symptoms: Overheating, coolant leaks, white smoke from tailpipe, heater not working, temperature gauge fluctuation
issues.description: The 928's V8 produces significant heat. The water pump, radiator's plastic end tanks, thermostat, and heater core are common failure points.
issues.keywords: cooling overheating water pump thermostat radiator heater core coolant v8

issues.title: Vacuum System Deterioration
issues.symptoms: Climate control not working, doors won't lock, cruise control failure, rough idle, brake booster issues
issues.description: The 928 uses vacuum to power many systems including HVAC controls, door locks, cruise control, and brake booster. Vacuum hoses become brittle and crack with age.
issues.keywords: vacuum hoses hvac climate control door locks cruise control brake booster

issues.title: Weissach Axle Suspension Wear (S4/GTS)
issues.symptoms: Rear-end wander, unpredictable handling at limit, clunking from rear, uneven rear tire wear
issues.description: Later 928 models use the Weissach rear axle, a sophisticated multi-link suspension that provides passive rear-wheel steering. The system uses multiple bushings that wear over time.
issues.keywords: weissach axle suspension rear bushings control arms handling s4 gts

issues.title: Pop-Up Headlight Failure
issues.symptoms: Headlights stuck up or down, slow headlight operation, one headlight won't open, motor noise but no movement
issues.description: The 928's pop-up headlights are operated by electric motors driving cables and linkages. Motors can fail, cables can break, and plastic linkage components can crack.
issues.keywords: pop-up headlights motors cables linkage stuck pivot

issues.title: Instrument Cluster and Electronics
issues.symptoms: Dead or flickering gauges, inaccurate readings, warning lights stuck on, odometer failure, dim display
issues.description: The 928's instrument cluster is a complex electronic unit. Circuit board solder cracks, capacitors fail, LCD displays fade, and odometer gears strip.
issues.keywords: instrument cluster gauges lcd display odometer capacitors circuit board

issues.title: Air Conditioning System Failures
issues.symptoms: No cold air, weak airflow, hot on one side and cold on the other, clicking from dashboard, refrigerant leaks
issues.description: The 928's automatic climate control system is advanced but old. The compressor, condenser, evaporator, and servo motors for blend doors can all fail.
issues.keywords: air conditioning ac hvac compressor condenser evaporator refrigerant r12 r134a

issues.title: IMS Bearing Failure
issues.symptoms: Metallic debris in oil, grinding noise from engine, sudden catastrophic engine failure, oil light flickering
issues.description: The Intermediate Shaft (IMS) bearing is the most feared issue on the M96 engine. When it fails, metal debris circulates through the engine, causing catastrophic damage.
issues.keywords: ims bearing intermediate shaft m96 engine failure debris oil

issues.title: Rear Main Seal (RMS) Leak
issues.symptoms: Oil drips from bell housing area, oil on clutch, burning oil smell, oil consumption
issues.description: The rear main seal on the M96 engine is known to leak. Oil leaks onto the clutch causing slipping and requiring clutch replacement along with the seal.
issues.keywords: rear main seal rms oil leak clutch bell housing m96

issues.title: Coolant Pipe Failure
issues.symptoms: Sudden coolant loss, overheating, coolant smell, puddle under car, white smoke from engine bay
issues.description: The 986 uses plastic coolant pipes that run under the intake manifold. These pipes become brittle with age and heat, eventually cracking and causing rapid coolant loss.
issues.keywords: coolant pipe plastic overheating intake manifold aluminum upgrade

issues.title: Convertible Top Issues
issues.symptoms: Top won't open/close, warning light on dash, hydraulic fluid leak, slow operation, top stops mid-cycle
issues.description: The 986 Boxster's convertible top mechanism is hydraulic and electrically controlled. Common failure points include the hydraulic pump, rams, and micro switches.
issues.keywords: convertible top hydraulic pump rams micro switches pentosin

issues.title: AOS (Air/Oil Separator) Failure
issues.symptoms: Rough idle, smoke from exhaust on startup, oil consumption, whistling noise, check engine light
issues.description: The Air/Oil Separator (AOS) is part of the crankcase ventilation system. When it fails, it causes vacuum leaks and allows oil into the intake.
issues.keywords: aos air oil separator crankcase ventilation vacuum leak oil consumption

issues.title: Bore Scoring / Cylinder Wear
issues.symptoms: Knocking noise from engine, increased oil consumption, smoke on startup, low compression
issues.description: Some M96 engines develop bore scoring - damage to the cylinder walls. It's more common on cars that sit for long periods or are driven short distances.
issues.keywords: bore scoring cylinder wear m96 lokasil oil consumption compression

issues.title: Window Regulator Failure
issues.symptoms: Window drops into door, grinding noise, slow window operation, window off track
issues.description: The 986 uses cable-driven window regulators with plastic components that fail. Frameless windows put more stress on the regulator system.
issues.keywords: window regulator cable plastic frameless door

issues.title: IMS Bearing Failure
issues.symptoms: Metallic debris in oil, grinding noise from engine, catastrophic engine failure, oil light flickering
issues.description: The 996 shares the M96 engine with the 986 Boxster and has the same IMS bearing issue. The bearing supports the intermediate shaft that drives the camshafts.
issues.keywords: ims bearing intermediate shaft m96 engine failure debris oil

issues.title: Bore Scoring / D-Chunk
issues.symptoms: Knocking noise, increased oil consumption, smoke from exhaust, loss of power, low compression
issues.description: The M96 engine can develop bore scoring or 'D-Chunk' where pieces of cylinder wall break away. This is a serious issue requiring engine rebuild.
issues.keywords: bore scoring d-chunk cylinder wall m96 engine rebuild compression

issues.title: Rear Main Seal (RMS) Leak
issues.symptoms: Oil drips from engine area, oil on clutch, burning oil smell, oil spots under car
issues.description: Like the 986, the 996's M96 engine rear main seal leaks over time, allowing oil to escape and potentially contaminate the clutch.
issues.keywords: rear main seal rms oil leak clutch m96

issues.title: AOS (Air/Oil Separator) Failure
issues.symptoms: Rough idle, smoke from exhaust, oil consumption, whistling noise from engine, check engine light
issues.description: The 996 shares the AOS design with the 986. When the diaphragm fails, it causes vacuum leaks and oil in the intake.
issues.keywords: aos air oil separator vacuum leak oil consumption crankcase ventilation

issues.title: Coolant System Failures
issues.symptoms: Overheating, coolant leaks, temperature warning, coolant smell, steam from engine area
issues.description: The 996 cooling system uses plastic components that fail with age. Coolant pipes, expansion tank, and water pump are common failure points.
issues.keywords: cooling overheating coolant pipes expansion tank water pump plastic

issues.title: Headlight Seal Failure (Fried Egg)
issues.symptoms: Moisture in headlights, foggy headlight lenses, yellowed headlights, water dripping from headlights
issues.description: The 996's distinctive 'fried egg' headlights are known for seal failure, allowing moisture to enter. This damages the reflectors and reduces light output.
issues.keywords: headlights fried egg seal moisture foggy yellowed lenses

issues.title: Suspension Wear
issues.symptoms: Clunking over bumps, vague steering, uneven tire wear, reduced handling precision
issues.description: The 996 suspension components wear over time. Control arm bushings, thrust arm bushings, and shock absorbers are common wear items.
issues.keywords: suspension bushings control arm thrust arm shocks handling

issues.title: IMS Bearing Failure (997.1 Only)
issues.symptoms: Metallic debris in oil, grinding noise from engine, catastrophic engine failure, oil warning light
issues.description: Early 997 models (997.1, 2005-2008) use the M96/M97 engine with IMS bearing issues. Later 997.2 models (2009+) use the improved 9A1 engine without this issue.
issues.keywords: ims bearing m96 m97 997.1 engine failure debris

issues.title: Bore Scoring (997.1 M97 Engine)
issues.symptoms: Engine knocking, increased oil consumption, smoke from exhaust, loss of power
issues.description: The 997.1 M97 engine can develop bore scoring like the M96. The 997.2 with the 9A1 engine doesn't have this issue.
issues.keywords: bore scoring m97 997.1 cylinder wall oil consumption engine rebuild

issues.title: PDK Transmission Issues (997.2)
issues.symptoms: Harsh shifts, shuddering, warning messages, delayed engagement, grinding noises
issues.description: The 997.2 introduced the PDK dual-clutch transmission. While generally reliable, issues can include clutch wear, mechatronics failures, and software glitches.
issues.keywords: pdk dual clutch transmission mechatronics 997.2 shifting clutch

issues.title: PASM Suspension Failures
issues.symptoms: PASM warning light, harsh ride, no difference between comfort and sport modes, leaking shocks
issues.description: PASM (Porsche Active Suspension Management) uses electronically adjustable shocks that can fail. The shocks are expensive to replace.
issues.keywords: pasm suspension shocks dampers electronic adjustable warning light

issues.title: Coolant Pipe and Water Pump Failures
issues.symptoms: Coolant leaks, overheating, coolant warning, steam from engine area, low coolant level
issues.description: The 997 uses plastic coolant components that can fail. The coolant pipes, expansion tank, and water pump are common failure points.
issues.keywords: coolant pipes water pump overheating plastic expansion tank

issues.title: Direct Fuel Injection Carbon Buildup (997.2)
issues.symptoms: Rough idle, misfires, reduced power, poor fuel economy, hesitation
issues.description: The 997.2's direct injection engine can develop carbon buildup on the intake valves since fuel doesn't wash over them like in port injection systems.
issues.keywords: carbon buildup direct injection intake valves dfi 997.2 walnut blasting

issues.title: Rear Main Seal Leak (997.1)
issues.symptoms: Oil drips from engine, oil on clutch, burning oil smell, oil spots under car
issues.description: The 997.1 with M97 engine can develop rear main seal leaks like the earlier M96 engines. The 997.2 with 9A1 engine has improved sealing.
issues.keywords: rear main seal rms oil leak m97 997.1 clutch
